author: seamonkey82
content:
What's going on here?
```
➜  lodestar git:(master) ✗ ./lodestar beacon --rootDir="$HOME/eth/kiln-lodestar-geth" --paramsFile="../config.yaml" --genesisStateFile="../genesis.ssz"  --eth1.enabled=true --execution.urls="http://127.0.0.1:8552" --network.connectToDiscv5Bootnodes --network.discv5.enabled=true --jwt-secret="/tmp/jwtsecret" --network.discv5.bootEnrs="enr:-Iq4QMCTfIMXnow27baRUb35Q8iiFHSIDBJh6hQM5Axohhf4b6Kr_cOCu0htQ5WvVqKvFgY28893DHAg8gnBAXsAVqmGAX53x8JggmlkgnY0gmlwhLKAlv6Jc2VjcDI1NmsxoQK6S-Cii_KmfFdUJL2TANL3ksaKUnNXvTCv1tLwXs0QgIN1ZHCCIyk" --port 13442 --enr.ip "1.2.3.4" --enr.tcp 13442 --enr.udp 13442 --eth1.depositContractDeployBlock 0 --eth1.providerUrls="http://127.0.0.1:8546"
 ✖ Error: string encoded ENR must start with 'enr:'
    at Function.decodeTxt (/home/seamonkey/Downloads/merge-testnets/kiln/lodestar/node_modules/@chainsafe/discv5/lib/enr/enr.js:92:19)
    at readEnr (file:///home/seamonkey/Downloads/merge-testnets/kiln/lodestar/packages/cli/src/config/enr.ts:28:14)
    at persistOptionsAndConfig (file:///home/seamonkey/Downloads/merge-testnets/kiln/lodestar/packages/cli/src/cmds/init/handler.ts:93:17)
    at Object.beaconHandler [as handler] (file:///home/seamonkey/Downloads/merge-testnets/kiln/lodestar/packages/cli/src/cmds/beacon/handler.ts:23:3)
```

author: vintageavocado
content: <@474451342094499868> if you didn't figure it out already; judging by a glance at the code its not really complaining about the bootEnrs argument, but rather trying to load an enr string from a file, you might have  a file called "enr" in your rootdir with something unexpected?
